        public void deployAsSecurityAdmin(HubConfigImpl hubConfig)

      • prepareAppConfigForDeployingToDhs

        protected void prepareAppConfigForDeployingToDhs(HubConfig hubConfig)
        The AppConfig object belonging to HubConfig can be configured based on known DHS environment settings. This minimizes the number of properties that a user needs to specify themselves - i.e. the user shouldn't be expected to configure all the properties that are known to be true about a DHS instance.
        Parameters:
        hubConfig -

      • removeHubInternalConfigFromConfigDirs

        protected void removeHubInternalConfigFromConfigDirs(com.marklogic.appdeployer.AppConfig appConfig)
        The contents of hub-internal-config should have been deployed to DHS already via the DHF installer. And it is expected that a user will have permission to deploy all of the resources in this directory.
        Parameters:
        appConfig -

      • setKnownValuesForDhsDeployment

        protected void setKnownValuesForDhsDeployment(HubConfig hubConfig)
        Per DHFPROD-2897, these are known values in a DHS installation that can be set so that they override any changes the user may have made for their on-premise installation.
        Parameters:
        hubConfig -

      • buildCommandsForSecurityAdmin

        protected java.util.List<com.marklogic.appdeployer.command.Command> buildCommandsForSecurityAdmin()

      • buildPatternForDatabasesToUpdateIndexesFor

        protected java.util.regex.Pattern buildPatternForDatabasesToUpdateIndexesFor()
        In a provisioned environment, only the databases defined by this pattern can be updated.
        Returns:
        database name pattern
